decks.notes: The main strategy of this Doomsday combo Legacy deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday and set up a winning combination of cards in order to win the game. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Thassa's Oracle, Brainstorm, Dark Ritual, Force of Will, and Doomsday to pull off the combo. It also includes a mix of control elements like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Fatal Push to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to efficiently search for key pieces while maintaining a strong defense to ensure a successful combo finish.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle to generate massive amounts of mana and play big threats like Wight of the Reliquary and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes several ways to search for key cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. With strong control elements like Thoughtseize and Sylvan Safekeeper, as well as powerful support cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Scythecat Cub, this deck aims to hit hard and fast while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The deck aims to quickly mill the entire library and win the game by casting Thassa's Oracle to win with an empty library. The deck has a heavy focus on quickly generating mana and getting key combo pieces onto the battlefield. Cabal Therapy helps disrupt opponents' game plans while cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Pact of Negation provide protection. Dark Ritual and Simian Spirit Guide help accelerate the combo, while Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer facilitate the mill strategy. The deck is all in on the combo, aiming to win the game as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on quickly playing spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent, while using disruptive elements like counterspells and removal to control the board. By combining aggressive creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter, Murktide Regent, and Dragon's Rage Channeler with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, the deck aims to put pressure on opponents early in the game. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and card selection to help maintain momentum. The deck also includes land destruction and efficient mana fixing to ensure a smooth curve of threats and answers.

The main objective of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and quickly overwhelm them with powerful creatures and burn spells. By playing cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon, it aims to shut down the opponent's nonbasic lands and prevent them from casting their spells effectively. The aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers are supported by burn spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption to deal direct damage and control the board. The deck aims to establish early dominance and close out the game quickly before the opponent can recover.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on early pressure and disruption through efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. It utilizes free counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. Card selection and velocity are enhanced with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also benefits from extra card advantage and filtering with Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Bauble. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while disrupting the opponent's mana base with Wasteland.

The deck aims to efficiently bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by leveraging cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat them into play without paying their mana cost. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and disruption with Stock Up and Cunning Wish to further support the game plan. The use of tutors like Intuition and Impulse helps to find key pieces of the combo, creating a strong and consistent strategy that relies on quickly assembling the combo pieces to win the game.

This Combo - Show and Tell legacy deck aims to cheat big, powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play as quickly as possible by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect your combo pieces, as well as card draw and manipulation cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Stock Up to ensure you draw into your combo pieces efficiently. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal and City of Traitors to help you ramp into your big creatures faster.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy while efficiently using mana acceleration cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to execute the combo. The deck's versatility allows it to adapt to different matchups and quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Sheoldred's Edict to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while playing aggressive creatures like Vicious Battlerager and Boggart Trawler, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and secure a fast victory. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from Dark Ritual and Chrome Mox, allowing for explosive starts and overwhelming board presence. Ultimately, the goal is to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.
